sentences: Ta on väga sitapea ja ei taha midagi õppida.
Ära ole nii sitapea, kuula mu nõuandeid!
See poiss on päris sitapea, ta teeb alati omapea.
context: The word 'sitapea' in Estonian is used to describe someone who is very stubborn and unwilling to listen to reason. It literally translates to 'pig head', implying a strong-willed, but perhaps foolish, insistence on one's own way.
